taxonomicnotes: Puntius chalakkudiensis was described by Menon, Remadevi and Thobias (1999) from the Chalakudy River, Kerala, India.
rationale: Puntius chalakkudiensis has been categorised as Endangered due to severely declining populations (50-70%) due to collections for the aquarium pet trade in addition to other threats that has resulted in the decline in the quality of habitat and also from exotic species introductions.
evaluator: Rema Devi, K.R., Gopalakrishnan, A., Shaji, C.P., Johnson, J.A., Arunachalam, M., Shrikant, J., Rahul, K., Krishna , K.K. & Molur, S.
